articles.title: Anthropic acquires computer-use AI startup Vercept after Meta poached one of its founders
articles.description: Seattle-based Vercept developed complex agentic tools, including a computer-use agent that could complete tasks inside applications like a person with a laptop would.
articles.author: Julie Bort

articles.title: Gushwork bets on AI search for customer leads — and early results are emerging
articles.description: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh

articles.title: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would.
articles.description: Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.
articles.author: Tim Fernholz

articles.title: The public opposition to AI infrastructure is heating up
articles.description: Public backlash over the data center boom is leading to a variety of draconian policies — including bans on new construction.
articles.author: Lucas Ropek

articles.title: OpenClaw creator's advice to AI builders is to be more playful and allow yourself time to improve
articles.description: Peter Steinberger talks about the creation of his viral AI agent OpenClaw and how being more "playful" makes for a better way to learn AI coding.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Wearable startup CUDIS launches a new health ring line with an AI-fueled ‘coach'
articles.description: The wearable incentivizes healthy behavior with points that can be redeemed for health products.
articles.author: Lucas Ropek

articles.title: OpenAI COO says ads will be ‘an iterative process'
articles.description: COO Brad Lightcap noted that ads can add to the product experience of users if they are done right. He urged to give OpenAI a few months to see how the company fares in rolling out the product.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: This isn't our first SaaSpocalypse
articles.description: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.
articles.author: Julie Bort

articles.title: Alphabet-owned robotics software company Intrinsic joins Google
articles.description: Nearly five years after graduating into an independent Alphabet company, Intrinsic is moving under Google's domain.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak

articles.title: Gemini can now automate some multi-step tasks on Android
articles.description: Gemini on Android will be able to automate tasks involving rideshare requests, or grocery or food delivery, says Google.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Nvidia has another record quarter amid record capex spends
articles.description: "The demand for tokens in the world has gone completely exponential," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said about the company's earnings.
articles.author: Russell Brandom

articles.title: Waymo to begin testing in Chicago and Charlotte
articles.description: Waymo this week will begin mapping and collecting data in Chicago and Charlotte. The move comes as Waymo announces it is currently operating its robotaxis fully autonomously in 10 US cities.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Have hard-won scaling lessons to share? Take the stage at TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026
articles.description: Apply to speak at TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026 by April 17 for a chance to lead a roundtable or breakout session for 1,000 founders and investors. If you’ve built, backed, or operated inside high-growth startups, your experience could shape how the next wave of founders scales.
articles.author: TechCrunch Events
